meanings.definition: The outermost layer of the cuticle in insects and other arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The epicuticle of the beetle protects it from harm.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the epicuticle of insects to understand their biology better.
meanings.sent3: The epicuticle of the ant made it look like it was wearing a shiny coat.
meanings.sent4: The epicuticle of the spider was as tough as armor.
meanings.sent5: The epicuticle, like a shield, shields the insect from the outside world.

meanings.definition: A waxy layer on the surface of plant leaves.
meanings.sent1: The epicuticle on the leaf helps reduce water loss.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often apply wax to mimic the natural epicuticle on plant leaves.
meanings.sent3: The epicuticle on the rose leaf made it look like it had been polished.
meanings.sent4: The epicuticle on the leaf glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The epicuticle, like a raincoat, protects the leaf from getting wet.
